column4: im new to linux, and im having trouble with updating my firefox. Its currently version 1.0.57. I downloaded the upaded to 1.5 .tar.gz what now?
one thing that i didnt like about firefox is the lack of plugins already installed
i agree with nicholaspaul, but i do have an open mind to browser suggestions
dillo is a very small and light browser that is strictly for html. no plugins, no java, no nothing
it formats the html right? or is it raw output. topyli
it shows html all right, formatted and laid out like any graphical browser. but that's all it does. it's very fast :)
can i have some links to opera or dillo
I'll google them. thanks for the help
try opera.com and dillo.org. or try to make a better guess :)
which package do i download. gnu-darin, rpms, netbsd?
i haven't seen opera for ages, but i'
looking at the download page, they seem to have ubuntu packages. how about those?
